reviews.sentence: The staff was very accommodating and apologetic for the issues that came up during the stay. The location is very good in relation to the downtown area. The front desk seemed confused. They said I had already checked in which I had not. When I walked into my room I found it occupied by someone else. The new room was not occupied but the glasses were dirty the bed sheets had a few holes in them.

Exceptional Service Great Location for Business or Pleasure. I travel every week and I select this Hilton for many reason I get exceptional service never had there been an incident where I had met a staff who is finding ways to make your stay easier comfortable and relaxing. View from this hotel is beautiful Lake which is lively during the summer and frozen during winter. But what makes this hotel different for me is the type of service I get week after week.

Beautiful would stay again. Perfect location clean modern. Very helpful and professional staff. Excellent views of the lake. Staff made my birthday morning special with a candle and muffins with our room service order. Would stay again in a heartbeat can not beat the location.

Convenient but Lousy Accommodations. The room was no where near worth the money I paid for it. The mattress was on the ground the phone in the room did not work and the lobby smelled moldy. The only good thing was that it was very close to the event I attended downtown. Next time I am in Madison I will definitely book at another hotel.

Great Location and Views. The Hilton is right downtown with great views of the Capitol or the Lake. The Hotel itself is a charming older building. Nicely appointed and decorated for the holidays. Parking is easy but have to go down several levels and the card reader did not work. This was not a problem as a ticket option was available. Rooms are clean and nicely appointed. The bath is standard size but clean and functional nice curved shower curtain rod gives extra space in shower. Bed is great to sleep on pillows are a bit overstuffed for us. there is a coffee and breakfast available if you need it. If you are wanting to eat at the ChopHouse make sure it is open. We usually stay on Sunday nights and it is closed a big disappointment for us as that is the night we are usually in Madison for dinner. Staff is very friendly and helpful. A great facility service staff and price. Highly recommend to anyone staying in the area.

Pleasant stay. Visited Madison with my family. Hotel in a great location offered digital check in and staff was extremely polite. did not eat at restaurant as the morning we went for breakfast the staff was busy chatting it up rather than helping my family but we found a gem down the block. See my other reviews from this trip for details. Overall good hotel but nothing extraordinary.

Great Location. We stayed at the hotel in late October and were very pleased with the location professional friendly service and many amenities. We had a Capital View room and loved it. We appreciated the valet service and underground parking. This is a first rate property and plan to stay there again when we visit Madison.

Nice hotel in the center of everything. We stayed over a weekend to visit family. The location was ideal for us within walking distance of so many shops restaurants and the amazing farmers market. Location staff Everything downtown is convenient as mentioned above. Walking bridge to Monona Terrace was a nice addition. The comforter on the bad was fluffy and luxurious but we could have used a lighter cover.

Location with Probation. This hotel is located proximate to the state capital building which is in the heart of town. If you are lucky enough to get a room with a view of Lake Monoa you will enjoy one of the best views in the state of Wisconsin. Unfortunately that is the best this hotel has to offer but their service and amenities go down hill from there. Acomomdations. The rooms are date and need a refresh. Hall ways and common areas are simple and a little worn. Their amenities are fine but nothing that is on par with the location. Bathrooms are small and cheaply appointed. The shower curtain was too small to cover the arched shower bar. Sink water pressure and hot water was very weak despite strong pressure and good heat in the shower which was quite odd. Service Our room was not cleaned until after 60 pm and housekeeping removed some personal items which could never have been mistaken as normal room amenities or trash not all were recovered from the hotel. They attempt to run it with a skeleton staff resulting in a very low level of service. Simply try calling the hotel to speak with someone and you will wait on hold for 20 minutes or more with no apology when they finally do answer. Restaurants. The breakfast at Capitol Chophouse was good with cooked to order omelettes and a buffet. Staff was slim in the restaurant and the ambiance was average. We did not patronize any other restaurants in the hotel. Overall there are likely better choices in this liberal college town. It is a shame that this Hilton does not live up to the excellent location that it holds.

Great Quality Location. This hotel has a great location in downtown Madison near the capitol building. Perfect for attending a concert at the Majestic Theatre which we did. Accommodations were excellent as was the staff. Parking is very reasonable. Have stayed here twice and will do so again.

Downtown location is nice but there is construction going on across the street from the Hotel at this time. Very close to the Capital and numerous excellent dining establishments. Room was clean but nothing out of the ordinary. I have stayed in better and worse. The staff is friendly and if you have pets they are pet friendly.

Hotel really needs renovating look at my pics. Leaving 3 stars 1 front desk personnel were awesome super nice and friendly. 2 Location can not be beat 3 we got a good price would not have been happy paying rack rate. Hilton is my preferred hotel choice for the record this did not live up to the name. The beds were VERY nice and comfortable. They definitely got the most important part of the hotel experience down but sadly it drops off from there. Please check out my pictures they tell the story better than I can. Where do I start. Our room had a bathtub I have not seen one in a Hilton quality hotel in a long time. It almost seemed treacherous. I am a healthy 40 male and I was a little nervous. The shower head was the basic type that looks like it was army issue. The room had those old AV jacks from last century. Curly cue CLF light bulbs plain basic outlets cracking wallpaper and water stains on the counter. Many of them. The air conditioner was so loud it kept me up for awhile so I turned it off. Overall just a worn feel to the room the one pic is of the bottom of the full length mirror. Like I started with we got a great price on the hotel. I looked up what regular price would have been and I was astounded. The Concourse was the same price. Final note. I had like to preempt the management response. None of this is your fault. the owners of the hotel need to reinvest in their property. It just is not Hilton quality IMO. Oh yeah if you are still reading you know this was helpful click the thanks thumbs up.

Would not stay again. Food was terrible and expensive. Air conditioners in rooms are so loud you ca nt sleep. Location was the only reason why this hotel was selected. Parking lot was full for guests so had to pay for the expensive valet.
Beautiful location excellent accommodations but the road construction made it very difficult to get to.
Fair. shuttle service to University. AC too noisyRom Cleaning very average Value for money.
did not spend the night but great service and location with parking.

Nice hotel Great Location. The hotel was comfortable. Check in was very easy and the staff were polite and professional. Only issue was valet took a while even though we called ahead to ask for our car can not beat the location. Walking distance to bars restaurants capital building.

We stayed two nights for a New years celebration. Everything seemed fine until we checked out at our regular scheduled time and noticed we had been charged for an additional night of parking which is around 1794 a night. This charge is still pending on our account and has been a thorn in our side. We have called numerous times to try and figure this out and we have even offered to just pay the charge as long as it is no longer pending. The front desk area was closed or relocated for construction and this was just one of many excuses we were given. Very disappointed with the customer service for this particular location we will not be staying again at this otherwise pleasant hotel.

Very nice. Our family stayed here so we could walk around downtown Madison and explore the city a little bit. Very close to the Capitol it was a great location and all of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. We would definitely choose this again if we were in the area.

The valet service was excellent. We liked the shuttle service but they did not know about the pick up and unload area right at the Aliant Energy Center. They wanted to drop us off across the street and have us walk to the Center. The television in the room did not work properly. We were told that they were in the middle of an upgrade. The pool was in the process of being renovated and so was the whirlpool they were both not operating. I wish that this would have been explained before the reservations were made. Because of these I feel the price for the room should have been reduced.

The room was real nice and clean. The staff on the frist day were friendly and helpful not so much the second day. Waited 15 mintues for my car frim valet because he also doubled as the shuttle driver. Manager told me it was Hilton policy that i should have called ahead if i wanted my car. After 20 years of staying at Hiltons i have never had to do this and it was not in any of the instructions they left in the room plus he was a real smart ass about it. The wifi was free the first day but on the second wanted to charge me.

will not be back because I actually like sleeping in hotels. Had a miserable stay. When I am at a hotel the ability to have a good nights sleep is paramount. It was a complete miss at this hotel. And you can not even get a free cup of coffee in the morning to attempt to cope. The AC unit is a lousy noisy ineffective demon. When we checked in the previous folks had the thermostat at 65 and it was cold. I understand why now after waking up sweating in the middle of the night and then waking up again when the AC kicked on. We set it on 68 at night. The AC is so loud that you had have to increase the volume on the TV 2 3 times to be able to listen. then the guilt of blasting your hotel neighbor with the TV would kick in and you had drop it back down. The TV had CC that worked most of the time so that was a compromise we figured out on day 2. For whatever reason the WiFi would not stay connected to my phone either. it is a Iphone 7S so may be a nuance of an older phone but it was a continual struggle that I did not experience in Racine the previous several days at a Doubletree. We had issues with check in as well the individual at the desk was training and did not authorize our key cards for the garage so we were trapped in the garage for 10 minutes until an awesome shuttle driver let us out. We also had to request the complimentary 2 bottles of water for our brand dedication aka silver. and while I am being completely annoyed at this hotel. we did not get room service for a single day and got a note under the door that management will enter our room if we deny maid service for 24 hours. What the hell is that about. The Doubletree we just left in Racine offered free points if you declined room service. that is the first time I have ever gotten a form letter like that for having the DND sign on the door for a day. Damn son. can not a girl have a late start to the day with delivery pizza and pajamas.
